text:
<@U024KA3A85Q>

I am no expert in the field but I do believe you will eventually need to build a dictionary. Even in Google Ads each ad account has different negative keywords that they need to add manually. Because the 'negative value' of a word for different contexts is different.

The way I would approach this is to try to understand the search intent of the 20% most searched terms and ensure great search results for them (probably manually). Such a list would then be useful for any 'smarter approach'.

text: I've lost a lot of money as a freelancer lol. I started suggesting Remitly to my client. Works very well for me.

text: For 1, you may be able to control what Boolean operators are used by your site’s search engine. You likely just need to switch it from OR to AND.

elements.text: For 1, you may be able to control what Boolean operators are used by your site’s search engine. You likely just need to switch it from OR to AND.

text: Hi! I found it helpful to have a professional in the recruiting space evaluate my resume and improve it/give feedback. I did it through Fiverr, they have resume checking services on there for reasonable prices, and the person that helped me had been in recruiting for many years so he knew what employers were looking for. He went through my resume and edited it a bit but also gave me feedback on why he made the changes. It definitely helped me. Also, having a portfolio linked in your resume with your best work is a good way to show companies the type of work you've done.
